Name: Research Skills in Egyptology
Aims: ALGY783 is designed to promote the acquisition of key skills of critical reading, project structuring, data collection, and the concise presentation of information to an audience. It will promote the development of attitudes of independent responsibility for argument from primary data. It will achieve the above primarily through focus on ancient Egyptian material culture as it relates to students' dissertation topics; The module is designed to provide structured experience of a corpus of primary data from Egypt, and acquisition of the skills to analyse and present such data. The module will seek not only to promote and explain good methodology for Egyptological research but also to enable a detailed understanding of the interconnections between artefacts and society in Egypt during the pharaonic period; The student will: Acquire an informed knowledge of the various areas of research within the Egyptology field; Develop a critical understanding of source-processing and evidence-led research; Develop the ability to organise research strategy and therefore create the basic framework of a dissertation proposal presenting data, aims and methodology.
Learning Outcomes:
(LO1) By the end of the module students will have gained familiarity with standard reference tools in Egyptology.
(LO2) Students will have considered research strategies appropriate to the subject.
(LO3) Students will have undertaken formal practice in the critical reading of Egyptological research.
(LO4) Students will have achieved a first exercise in writing for a research audience.
(LO5) Students will have practiced professional employability skills

Name: Hlc Research Masters Dissertation
Aims:
To provide the guidance and support to allow the student to complete a major piece of independent study to a high standard;
To encourage the student to develop as a member of a scholarly research community through providing opportunitie to integrate within that community.
Learning Outcomes:
(LO1) By completing a project successfully the student will have made a contribution to scholarly research and / or methodological development in their chosen field.
(LO2) The student will have gained a good understanding of the conventions of scholarly research in their area of study and be able to work appropriately within these conventions.
(LO3) The student will have demonstrated a practical understanding of how established techniques of research and enquiry are used to create and interpret knowledge in the discipline.
(LO4) The student will have demonstrated self-direction and originality in identifying and addressing problems and ability to act autonomously in planning and implementing a project to a high level of competency.
